summary: This document is an email chain from September 19, 2019, in which NBC News producer Sarah Fitzpatrick urgently requests comment from the FBI regarding allegations from an interview subject. The subject claims she was directed by Jeffrey Epstein and/or his associates to have sex with prominent men, identified them to the FBI in 2011, and that an FBI agent later told her he was instructed to stop investigating Epstein. The FBI's National Press Office is the recipient.

persons.name: Sarah Fitzpatrick
persons.context: She is the NBC News producer who sent the urgent request for comment to the FBI, detailing allegations from an interview subject about Jeffrey Epstein and the FBI's investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the NBC News report; multiple women allege they were sexually abused by him, and an interview subject claims she was directed by him and/or his associates to engage in sexual activity with other men.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Identified by an interview subject as one of the prominent men in Epstein's orbit she was directed to have sex with, according to court filings and an interview.

persons.name: Bill Richardson
persons.context: Identified by an interview subject as one of the prominent men in Epstein's orbit she was directed to have sex with, according to court filings and an interview.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Abuse Period
events.description: An interview subject alleges she was directed by Jeffrey Epstein and/or his associates to engage in sexual activity with other men on multiple occasions in the U.S. and abroad.

events.title: FBI Interview in Sydney
events.description: An interview subject says she was interviewed by the FBI at the U.S. Consulate in Sydney, Australia. She claims she provided the FBI with the names of men she was directed to have sex with and was shown photos of prominent men in Epstein's orbit.

events.title: Alleged FBI Investigation Halt
events.description: The interview subject claims an FBI agent told her via phone in 2014 that 'his head had been cut off above him' and that he was instructed to stop investigating the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned NBC News Broadcast
events.description: NBC News was preparing a report about Jeffrey Epstein for broadcast on Dateline and other programs as soon as September 20, 2019.

keyFacts: An interview subject alleges she was directed by Jeffrey Epstein and/or his associates to have sex with prominent men, including Alan Dershowitz, Bill Richardson, George Mitchell, Glenn Dubin, Jean-Luc Brunel, and Prince Andrew, from 2000-2002.
The same subject claims she was interviewed by the FBI in Sydney, Australia in March 2011, where she provided these names to agents and was shown photos for identification.
The subject alleges that in 2014, an FBI agent told her he was instructed to stop investigating the Epstein case, using the phrase 'his head had been cut off above him'.
NBC News producer Sarah Fitzpatrick confirms reviewing emails that reflect the 2011 meeting and subsequent FBI correspondence, and is urgently seeking confirmation and comment from the FBI.
The names of the interview subject and the specific FBI agents involved are redacted in the document text.
